content.statement: aaa-019-ruptured-management is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aaa Treatment that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding aaa-019-ruptured-management helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of aaa-019-ruptured-management include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of aaa-019-ruptured-management.

atypical_presentations: Isolated back pain mimicking renal colic
Flank ecchymosis (Grey Turner sign) - late finding
Leg ischemia from thromboembolism or shock

stable.management: May proceed to CTA, consider rEVAR

unstable.management: Permissive hypotension, expedited repair, limited imaging

moribund.management: REBOA bridge, immediate OR, damage control

diagnosis: Bedside ultrasound (FAST) - identifies AAA, may see free fluid
CT angiography - gold standard if patient stable enough
Clinical diagnosis sufficient in classic presentation with known AAA

permissive_hypotension.rationale: Preserves retroperitoneal tamponade, minimizes ongoing hemorrhage

massive_transfusion.adjuncts: TXA 1g bolus, calcium replacement, avoid hypothermia

REBOA.indication: Bridge to definitive repair in moribund patients
REBOA.limitations: Ischemia to viscera and spine, must proceed rapidly to repair

rEVAR.advantages: Faster aortic control, preserves retroperitoneal tamponade, lower blood loss
rEVAR.anatomy_requirements: Similar to elective EVAR, but more aggressive on-table IFU

open_repair.indication: Unsuitable anatomy, failed EVAR, hemodynamic collapse
open_repair.approach: Midline laparotomy, suprarenal or infrarenal clamp

decision_algorithm.step_1: Recognize rAAA: pain + hypotension + known/palpable AAA
decision_algorithm.step_2: Activate MTP and vascular surgery team simultaneously
decision_algorithm.step_5a: If stable: CTA → rEVAR if suitable anatomy
decision_algorithm.step_5b: If unstable: OR for open repair or intraoperative imaging for rEVAR
decision_algorithm.step_6: Damage control principles: temporary closure if coagulopathic
decision_algorithm.step_8: Planned second-look at 24-48h if concern for bowel ischemia

definition.@value: Systematic approach to diagnosis and treatment of ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm, emphasizing permissive hypotension, massive transfusion, and expedited repair via EVAR or open surgery

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Recognize classic and atypical presentations of ruptured AAA
Apply hemodynamic stratification to guide management intensity
Explain the physiologic rationale for permissive hypotension
Determine EVAR vs open repair candidacy in ruptured AAA
Describe the role of REBOA as a bridge to definitive repair
Apply damage control surgery principles in the coagulopathic patient
clinical_pearls: 50% of rAAA patients die before reaching hospital - those who arrive represent survivors
A talking, oriented patient with SBP 80 is safer than one aggressively resuscitated to SBP 120
Loss of retroperitoneal tamponade at laparotomy can cause precipitous hemodynamic collapse
REBOA buys time but causes distal ischemia - proceed immediately to definitive repair
Crystalloid is the enemy in rAAA - use blood products from the start
Consider temporary abdominal closure if >10 units PRBCs or coagulopathy persists
